alert.note: Alert for Dewey; Stanley (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 26 at 3:48PM MDT by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Stanley and south central Dewey Counties through 415 PM MDT... At 347 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles northwest of Sansarc, or 24 miles south of Eagle Butte, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Stanley and south central Dewey Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
